p.k: In this episode, we explore the city of Valletta, the capital of the Republic of Malta. Designated as a World Heritage Site, it's a walled city built by Christian Knights during the 16th century.
p.d: In this episode, we stroll around the city of Valletta, the capital of the Republic of Malta which is a small island off the shore of Italy. A World Heritage Site, Valletta is a walled city built by Christian Knights during the 16th century. The old fortresses, churches and buildings of that era are still used to this day. We meet and talk with residents who maintain the traditions of the Knights.
